definition: to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
to appear on stage in an amateur capacity/(of a professional) to make a guest appearance/(fig.) to assume a role outside one's usual duties/to substitute for
to establish ties or contact/in series connection (electricity)
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
one after the other/a succession of/a series of
to miss a line/to confuse two lines
to miss a line/to confuse two lines
to collude to fabricate a story
to become tainted with the smell of sth else/to pick up an odor

sentences.english: This study is significant for generation of ultra-short optical pulse chain at high repetition rate.
sentences.chinese: 該研究對高重複率脈衝串產生具有一定意義。

sentences.english: The pearls are all about the same size. It's quite a short necklace.
sentences.chinese: 是由小顆的珍珠串起來的很短的項鍊。

sentences.english: First we got a bottle hooked to a key-chain.
sentences.chinese: 我們用鑰匙鏈和瓶子串在一起。
烹飪前先把雞肉串起來。

sentences.english: Displays a message box with an unformatted string and an OK button.
sentences.chinese: 用未格式化的串和OK按鈕顯示消息。

sentences.english: Girl sold a total of about 20 strings, flushed face was brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 女孩總共大約賣了20串，紅撲撲的臉上很燦爛。

sentences.english: Mystically it appears linked on a long silk string.
sentences.chinese: 神祕看起來連接在長的絲綢串。

sentences.english: The young couple next to me were feeding each other tofu skewers.
sentences.chinese: 我旁邊的一對年輕情侶在相互餵食豆腐串。

sentences.english: With heart of Romaine, Parmesan, Anchovy Dressing and Cajun dusted Prawn skewers.
sentences.chinese: 配羅馬菜心，帕馬森芝士粉，銀魚柳和蝦串。

sentences.english: Then kushi is the place to be!
It's like a lots of little rings all joined together.
sentences.chinese: 就好像很多小圓環串在一起。

sentences.english: Flavorful yakitori skewers are the highlights.
sentences.chinese: 可口的烤雞肉串是這家餐廳的特色。

sentences.english: The beads were strung on very fine nylon.
sentences.chinese: 珠子被串在十分細的尼龍絲上。

sentences.english: She strung the beads with a fine nylon.
sentences.chinese: 她用細尼龍線把珠子串了起來。

definition: to rinse/to trick/to fool sb/to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)
sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
